title: 820-3115 chime but no display
message:
820-3115 board. came in water damage.

now it chimes but i get no image (when i shine a light on the back i see no apple, also not with a different screen.)

i have 3,3volts on J9000 pin 4 so it is recognizing lcd.

I am missing LCD_IG_PWR_EN     0Volt.

LCD_IG_PWR_EN comes from U1800
but am I wrong to think if I get a chime then u1800 gets power?

what am I missing

title: 820-3115 chime but no display
message: Im Assuming youve inspected the LVDS connector? try shine a light on the inside, see if the connectors burnt. Yes all main power rails are present if you are getting a chime.

title: 820-3115 chime but no display
message: USB mouse light up?

title: 820-3115 chime but no display
message:
Of course USB mouse will light up, it is chiming.
LCD is NOT recognized pin 4 is connected to 3V3_S0! SMC_LID high?

title: 820-3115 chime but no display
message: hi duke. 3.4volt on SMC_LID

title: 820-3115 chime but no display
message:
In this board I found out that if lvds connector is bad then LCD_IG_PWR_EN will appear only for first 8 segs. So you must check as soon as you connect magsafe.
Duke will correct me if I am wrong.

title: 820-3115 chime but no display
message: thanks MDY but no power at first8 secs. flat 0,000

title: 820-3115 chime but no display
message: Pin 4 6 and 7 are needed for LCD recognition, check connector.

title: 820-3115 chime but no display
message:
pin 4, 6, 7 al are 3,3volts

R9008 is 9,85k when no lcd kabel connected
R9009 is 9,84k when no lcd kabel connected

red on pin 6 black on pin 7 gives me 19,87k lcd kabel not connected.

with kabel connected is drops to 6.4k (don't know if that normal don't have a second machine for testing)
I don't think that's good, but Ill wait for you :)

title: 820-3115 chime but no display
message: FYI I think the USB mouse is to test if BIOS initializes USB. Also good way to check if a fuse has blown to USB port if you get one non working port or whatever.

title: 820-3115 chime but no display
message: Diode measurement on pin 6 and 7?

title: 820-3115 chime but no display
message:
No lcd connected
pin 6 0.542
pin 7 0.544

Lcd connected
pin 6 0.562
pin 7 0,502

red on ground.

title: 820-3115 chime but no display
message: It should never go up when LCD connected, always down. Check again.

title: 820-3115 chime but no display
message:
0576 pin 6
0581 pin 7

connected
pin 6 0.562
pin 7 0,502

title: 820-3115 chime but no display
message: Check if pin 4 6 and 7 have continuity to the other end of a separate LCD cable plugged in.

title: 820-3115 chime but no display
message: These have no GPU and I doubt the PCH is bad. Check SMC_LID again and the 100K pull-up resistor on this line. Inspect the LCD connector closely for corrosion and replace to be sure. You have done a PRAM reset?!

R5071 99.2k

checked connector looked good, made sure to replace it stil same

title: 820-3115 chime but no display
message: Check with Oscope if there is any pulses on pin 6 and 7.

title: 820-3115 chime but no display
message:
i am probably gone say something stupid today....

I took out my rigol and normaly I can get the lines big inuf so I can see it going up and down somehow today.......pffffff

pin 6 and 7 both vmax jump between 3,2v and 3,6v
pin 6 and 7 both vavg jump between 3.02v and 3.06v
pin 6 and 7 both vmin jumpo between 2.v and 2.4v

line is like picture, voltage set on 1 volt

title: 820-3115 chime but no display
message:
Yeah I suggest you first find some Oscope tutorials. You need to set the time base to match the expected signal, also select DC coupled. There will only be a short burst of data on this bus after power on, this will be hard to catch so you cannot mess with the scope to find the correct time base. 
I dunno with this board now, willing to send it my way so I can have a look?

title: 820-3115 chime but no display
message:

QUOTE]

title: 820-3115 chime but no display
message: It says nothing, it is just a voltage. There is no data by the looks of it. The burst of data on this bus will be very short and you will need to "catch" it. No idea if your scope can store data like that,

message: Of course all those signals are missing when the LCD is not recognized. You know where to send it.
